summary: This document is a formal notification from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to 30 identified minor victims (listed as Jane Doe #1-30) of Jeffrey Epstein, informing them of their status as victims under the non-prosecution agreement. It includes an acknowledgment signed by Jeffrey Epstein and witnessed by his attorney, Roy Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual who committed the offenses against the minor victims and who entered into an agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the notification document.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: The attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who witnessed Epstein's acknowledgment of the notification.

connections.description: Roy Black is identified as Epstein's attorney, as Epstein acknowledges receiving the notification from him.
The document states Epstein committed offenses against the 30 identified individuals while they were minors.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, represents the office that entered into an agreement with Epstein regarding the prosecution of his crimes.

events.title: Issuance of Victim Notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally notifies 30 individuals that they are identified as minor victims of Jeffrey Epstein under the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Epstein's Acknowledgment of Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs an acknowledgment, witnessed by his attorney Roy Black, confirming his understanding of the notification and agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally identified 30 minor victims (Jane Doe #1-30) of Jeffrey Epstein under the non-prosecution agreement.
The document states the Office was prepared to name these individuals as victims in an indictment charging Epstein.
The notification is intended to place the victims in the same legal position as if Epstein had been convicted of the federal offenses.
Jeffrey Epstein, through his attorney Roy Black, acknowledged receipt and understanding of the notification, waiving certain evidentiary challenges.
